intro: Zexmenia pseudosilphioides f. discolor, commonly known as the variegated zexmenia, is a rare and striking plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its bean-like pods and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant is notable for its distinctive foliage, featuring a unique variegation pattern of white and green on its leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires a tropical to subtropical climate. Due to its rarity and ornamental value, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
